Articles.Content: currently delayed due to protests at the launch site, also the subcontractor who moves the Ariane 5 from its assembly building to the pad is on strike. I doubt the issue will be resolved soon.  https://twitter.com/DutchSpace/status/844178875601080321
Are they protesting the launch? Or are they protesting something else?
Seems to be labor related, not sure who though.

They're protesting the general living and working conditions in Kourou, the use of foreign instead of local equipment in Arianespace projects, and CNES' influence on a government-owned medical institution, which they feel threatens privatization of said institution.

Basically, it has nothing whatsoever to do with launching rockets, and everything with local politics. (Source)

Edited March 23, 2017 by Streetwind

Looks like launches have been suspended indefinitely. Definitely will affect ses 15, maybe future launches. 

https://spaceflightnow.com/2017/03/23/launches-from-kourou-suspended-by-social-unrest/

Looks like further delays as strikes expand. US has issued travel warnings for French Guiana as well. http://spacenews.com/ariane-5-launch-facing-further-delays-as-a-general-strike-hits-french-guiana/
